headline.main: 26 NEW HOTELS HERE.; Buildings Going Up Will Add 16,324 Rooms to City's Accommodations.

THE WILLARD HOTEL IN CAPITAL IS SOLD; Passes to New Company Headed by F.H. Hight, Manager, From Boomer-du Pont Interests. HAS HISTORIC ASSOCIATIONS Hostelry, With Predecessors on the Same Site, Has Had Many Distinguished Guests.

docs.abstract: Editoral on Commercial Travelers Natl League thoughts on bldg own tipless hotels
docs.lead_paragraph: Contrary to report, the 450,000 commercial travelers of the United States have not yet formed a company for the erection of "tipless" hotels, but they are thinking about it. We are informed by Mr. W.E. ADAMS, Vice President of the Commercial Travelers' National League, that they are thinking about it seriously.

headline.main: HOTEL FOR WORKING GIRLS.; W.R.H. Martin Files Plans for a $150,000 Structure.

docs.lead_paragraph: W.R.H. Martin will build a six-story hotel for working girls at the southwest corner of Hudson and West Twelfth Streets, at a cost of $150,000.
